DOC.brief_summary: The study was conducted to evaluate the effect of anti-viral treatment on long-term outcome on patients with chronic hepatitis B.
DOC.brief_title: Observational Study on Patients With Chronic Hepatitis B
DOC.criteria: Male or female, aged over 30 (inclusive) years of old Patients has a history of diagnosis of chronic hepatitis B (ie. HBsAg positive for more than 6 months) For patients with HBsAg positive, patients should be undergoing antiviral treatment For patients with HBsAg negative, a documented evidence of previous antiviral treatment should be provided. Life expectancy is more than 1 year Good treatment compliance. Patients has a history of diagnosis of hepatocellular carcinoma Patients with Child Pugh C Coinfected with HCV, HDV and HIV Suffering from other serious disease Taking part in other clinical trial
